title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 251.2 - Employer's returns and payment of City of Yonkers income tax surcharge withheld
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 § 251.2 - Employer's returns and payment of City of Yonkers income tax surcharge withheld

State Regulations

Tax Law, § 1329; Codes and Ordinances of the City of

Yonkers, § 92-88

Every employer required to deduct and withhold City of

Yonkers income tax surcharge on residents, pursuant to section
1329
of the Tax Law and section 92-88 of
the Codes and Ordinances of the City of Yonkers, shall file an employer's
return and with such return pay over to the Department of Taxation and Finance
the amount of the City of Yonkers income tax surcharge so required to be
deducted and withheld. An employer's return of City of Yonkers income tax
surcharge withheld must be filed in the same manner as is provided for in Part
174 of this Title. However, in determining the threshold for filing such
employer' s return and making payment of City of Yonkers income tax surcharge
withheld, the amount of City of Yonkers income tax surcharge required to be
deducted and withheld shall be aggregated with the amounts of New York State
personal income tax, City of New York personal income tax on residents, City of

New York earnings tax on nonresidents and City of Yonkers earnings tax on
nonresidents required to be deducted and withheld, and the total of all such
withheld amounts determines the manner and timing of filing such employer's
returns and making payment of such withheld amounts. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§
251.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
